Title: Illusory victories of the Russian Federation: what the enemy invents to divert attention from large-...
Description: Moreover, the MORF regularly reports on the -destruction- of HIMARS launchers, the number of which has already exceeded that received by Ukraine. About writes Center for Strategic Communications and Information Security. These statements are aimed at supporting the illusion of Russia's -greatness-, because Russian propaganda has always operated on the principle of quantitative exaggeration. For example, back in 2017, Sergei Shoigu reported on the -laying off- of 500,000 km² in Syria, although the area of ​​the entire country is only 185,000. km². At the same time, the real facts remain outside the official summaries. By report of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, in November, the Russian army suffered the largest irreversible and sanitary losses in force since the beginning of the large-scale invasion: during this month, our soldiers -two hundred- and -three hundred- 45,720 enemy soldiers. But this data is overlooked by propagandists who focus on creating their own illusory victories. After all, the Russians can indeed shoot down Ukrainian missiles with oil depots, airfields or military factories. Such fake -reports- not only create a false picture of reality for the domestic audience, but are also designed to divert attention from Russia's large-scale losses and failures at the front.

Title: A serious reason for neurosis in the Kremlin: Germany is waiting for a missile capable of -penetrati...
Description: However, as informs the portal of the influential German publication Der Spiegel, the Bundeswehr does not yet have an appropriate budget for this is an important project, ArmyInform reports. According to the publication, the Ministry of Defense of the Federal Republic of Germany presented to the budget committee of the Bundestag the profile of the corresponding project in confidential documents for the state budget for 2025. Accordingly, from a military point of view, it makes sense to order 600 Taurus Neo cruise missiles for approximately €2.1 billion. The first units of long-range weapons may be delivered in 2029. The decision to develop Taurus Neo, according to German observers, marks a significant step in modernizing Germany's military potential and strengthening its strategic position in a tense geopolitical context. According to German media reports, the Taurus Neo project is aimed at expanding the capabilities of the existing Taurus KEPD 350 cruise missile. In particular, according to German parliamentary sources, the modification involves increasing the flight range, increasing the accuracy of hitting targets and the power of the warhead. The Taurus Neo's technical improvements are expected to include a flight range exceeding 500 km. The guidance system will be modernized, it will integrate advanced technologies of inertial navigation and GPS correction to increase accuracy for detecting hard-to-reach targets. It is also assumed that the missile will be equipped with a more powerful warhead designed to penetrate heavily fortified structures such as bunkers or underground storage facilities. In addition, the Taurus Neo can include anti-missile defense bypass technologies, which increases the missile's ability to evade enemy radars and anti-aircraft defenses. Currently, the German armed forces have at their disposal approximately 600 Taurus KEPD 350 missiles, which are mainly used on Tornado fighters. Although the missile has also been tested on the Eurofighter EF2000, this aircraft is not yet used as a standard launch platform for the Taurus. The upcoming conclusion from the operation of Tornado fighters raises the question of the launch platform for the Taurus Neo. As such, the Eurofighter is the Bundeswehr's most likely option, while integration with the F-35As recently ordered by Germany is unlikely without a full redesign of the missile to match the internal compartment of the American stealth fighter. Experts of the IKK defense portal Defense Express (DE) reminded that the first batch of Taurus missiles in 600 units cost the Germans €570 million, deliveries continued until December 2010. As reported by ArmyInform , Taurus missiles in Germany were repeatedly requested by Ukraine. However, the chancellor of the country, Olaf Scholz, makes categorical statements from time to time that Germany will not transfer these long-range weapons to Ukraine, and the other day he noted that he will not change his position on this issue. As of today, according to data by the authors of the DE portal, Germany does not produce Taurus cruise missiles. Last year, the CEO of MBDA Deutschland, Joachim Knopf, stated that it would take a year to resume production of these weapons, taking into account delays in the delivery of electronics or explosives. As reported, in the long term, Germany could consider integrating the Taurus Neo into the FCAS (Future Combat Air System) is a next-generation fighter project developed in cooperation with France, Spain and Belgium. Despite the fact that in the coming decades, the US Air Force is expected to play a central role in the modernization of European air forces. In Germany, it is believed that the Taurus Neo technology could have significant implications for European defense. As a high-precision, long-range weapon, this missile can enhance deterrence capabilities while offering additional strategic capabilities for the continent's collective defense. However, the financing of the Taurus Neo project remains a serious problem for the German government. So, according to data reporters of the defense portal The War Zone, the budget of the Federal Republic of Germany for 2025 will require include the €350 million required to launch development, and current budget constraints may affect costs in the coming years. However, the support expressed by the government coalition in Germany indicates a favorable outcome for the implementation of the project, despite possible debates in the German parliament regarding the feasibility of prioritizing such costs in difficult economic conditions. The announcement of the Taurus Neo project came just two days after the signing of a historic defense agreement between Germany and the United Kingdom aimed at accelerating the development of a new, more advanced long-range missile than the Storm Shadow. This agreement was followed by the announcement of the UK joining the European Strike Program (ELSA): a French-led initiative that includes Germany, Poland and Italy. As part of ELSA, it is planned to develop a missile with a flight range of 1,000 km. up to 2 thousand km by 2030. Taurus KEPD 350 cruise missile. Video: Luftwaffe/Bundeswehr

Title: -The U.S. military was cool long before 2022-: about the war of the Hornet, Chip and Dale and the fi...
Description: Experienced artilleryman Major Kostyantyn Rymarenko told ArmyInform about what the long years of war in Donbas since 2014 gave the Ukrainian army, why the armed forces were cool long before the large-scale attack of the Russian Federation on Ukraine, as well as why UAVs are critical for artillery with the call sign -Khorunzhiy-. Military -Khorunzhiy- began his career in 2012 with ordinary military service. Then, as a graduate of the Alfred Nobel University in Dnipropetrovsk, he had to serve only 9 months. However, in the end, this short term was only the beginning of a long military career, during which he went from a soldier to a major. To the question about the military department during higher education, the officer answers awkwardly, noting that this is a separate sad story. Unfortunately, during the 1990s and early 2000s, and especially after 2010, the system of training military personnel through military departments at universities was largely disorganized. So the future officer began his service in the army -on a general basis- and now does not regret it. He recalls that during the conscript service, despite the chronic underfunding, outdated material base and remnants of the -Soviet regime-, military affairs were taught qualitatively. - In Divychki, conscripts were taught very well - no worse than officers are taught now. Everything was very well organized, it was very cool training - no questions. Almost everything I know about artillery, how it works, all the basics, I know because of my military service. Really taught very well. Although it was a bit -long- (smiles - author), they taught everything - from A to Z. They laid a very strong base, - says the gunner. All the best from this basis, he believes, allowed the Armed Forces of Ukraine to give a worthy rebuff to the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine in 2014 and became a reliable basis for the further development of the Ukrainian army. The following years before a large-scale attack were also not wasted, so the ASU was already cool well before 2022. Kostyantyn Rymarenko met Russia's attack on Ukraine in the ranks of the Armed Forces, because he signed a contract after the -period-. So we can say that he has been fighting since the very first days of the more than ten-year war. — In 2014, the 25th brigade was the first to leave for Donbas in a convoy, it was the first battalion tactical group (battalion tactical group — author) of the first battalion. On March 10, 2014, we went to the area of ​​the Amvrosiivka settlement. The first 150 km went well - people supported, helped, gave all kinds of -little things-, says the officer. Then the problems began - people in civilian clothes obstructed the movement of convoys of military equipment, blocking roads and chasing traffic. Voyskovyi recalls that the demonstrators were not only extremely decorated due to anti-Ukrainian propaganda, but also well coordinated - it was noticeable that someone was leading them. - Everything was coordinated to the point that they knew the point where it would be most profitable to stop the convoy. Because a convoy is a lot of armor and wheels, it is a military Ural. We often drove on dirt roads, fields - and people in civilian clothes clearly met us where we had to enter the paved road. They already stood at that place in advance, that is, they were coordinated, because they themselves could not follow our movement and understand where exactly we were going, -Khorunzhiy- recalls. The crowd blocking the road could number from a few dozen to two or three hundred people, who had to be bypassed, persuaded or even dispersed by force. It was noticeable that the hysteria among the locals was being specially fanned, and in the crowds you could see trained -activists- provocateurs who organized everything. The further combat path of the gunner lay through Amvrosiivka, Sloviansk, Debaltseve, Shakhtarsk… The attempt to liberate Donetsk in mid-August 2014 was memorable, during which units of the brigade were supposed to move from Debaltsevo through Nizhnya Kryna in the direction of Khartsyzk. It was then, the officer is convinced, that Russia's first large-scale attack on Ukraine took place. Before that, the Russian Federation operated through special services, organizing, coordinating and supplying weapons to Russian and pro-Russian militants. In the last decade of August 2014, the neighboring aggressor state directly used units of its regular army. Then one group of Ukrainian troops, says -Khorunzhy-, advanced through Nizhnya Kryna to the south, while the second was to go north to Khartsyzk from the side of Ilovaisk. They both had about 7 kilometers to go. — 14 kilometers — and Donetsk would be in a cauldron. But on August 24-25, 2014, the first full-scale invasion of Russia took place, which was hidden. The Ilovai group had an option to come to us to the north, and if we hit each other at the same time, we would meet in Khartsyzka, and everything would be fine, the gunner explains. To prevent this plan, Russia was forced to use units of the regular army, because there were clearly not enough Russian and pro-Russian fighters, and they did not have any tangible support among the local population. Khorunzhiy spent the next six years in a war that many Ukrainians chose not to notice. Meanwhile, soldiers of the Armed Forces defended Ukraine, restraining the enemy in the East of the country. The defenders gave their lives and health, for years they almost did not see their relatives and friends, while the rest of the country continued to live their usual lives. — During the year, we spent 10 months in the ATO/OO zone, then two months at home. Of these two months, we spent one at the training ground, and the other was at the PPD (permanent deployment point - author) and went to training. That is, during my service, I almost did not see my own family, my children, - explains the soldier. However, this time did not pass in vain either for Konstantin himself or for the Armed Forces. -Khorunzhiy- was trained and obtained the rank of primary officer, served in the command and artillery reconnaissance battery, was a platoon commander and a battery commander. And the Ukrainian army has gone through an important path of modernization and gaining combat experience. — In May 2015, I went to study. We mastered the AN/TPQ-48 - studied, disassembled, assembled, repaired. We were well taught in electronics, then there were also courses. After all, in November 2015, I was given the rank of junior lieutenant, - recalls Kostyantyn Rymarenko. The AN/TPQ-48 is an American man-portable counter-battery radar station designed to detect enemy mortar installations. Together with other innovations and assistance from partners, it became very helpful during the war in Eastern Ukraine. In 2020, Kostyantyn Rymarenko resigned from the Armed Forces, hoping to spend more time with his family and recall his civilian specialty as a marketer. However, a large-scale attack by the Russian Federation disrupted all plans for a peaceful life. - From the very morning of February 24, I sent my family to my relatives, and I immediately took my bag - all the military property I had - and went to the military commissariat. When I arrived, they didn't even know what to do and how to do it. And I was already completely gathered at their door. I was quickly taken through all the offices, all the officers - and on the same day I went to the brigade, -Khorunzhiy- recalls. Several days were spent on organizational work, and already on February 27, the officer left for Donbas, where to this day he defends Ukraine as part of his native 25th separate Sicheslav Airborne Brigade. — When I put my family in the car and sent them to my relatives, took my bag and went to the military checkpoint, I honestly thought I was going to die. I did not believe that we would succeed. But maybe it's because everyone thought so and everyone left - that's why we survived and are still standing, the soldier explains. He is sure that it was the simultaneous rise and joint efforts of Ukrainians, primarily those who gained military experience during the war in the East in 2014-2022, that allowed Ukraine to withstand the extremely difficult conditions of the first months of the large-scale invasion. Another key to the successful defense of Ukraine is the creativity of Ukrainian defenders and innovation in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Ukrainians brought knowledge, skills, skills and even hobbies acquired in civilian life to the Armed Forces - and this gave a colossal result. — In civilian life, I had a hobby — I flew on FPVs, on quadcopters. Thanks to this, we were the first in the brigade to fly a quadcopter. At the beginning of the large-scale invasion, there was only one Mavic in the division. Three officers flew on it: I, at that time a senior lieutenant and commander of intelligence, also a senior lieutenant - the deputy commander of a battery from the MPZ - and a division commander in the rank of lieutenant colonel, - says the military man. Before that, the gunners had only wing-type UAVs, and they were even afraid to fly on the recently handed over single Mavic, so as not to lose it. However, in the end, the gunners confidently mastered the new technique and ensured an extremely high result. Three officers took turns flying one drone and directly adjusted fire, transmitting data by radio to the gun commanders. This made it possible to quickly adjust fire and achieve significant accuracy. The scaling of the same process and the significant increase in the number of UAVs made it possible to spread the acquired experience to other artillery divisions of the brigade - and drones changed everything. — If we had as many drones at the beginning of the war as we do now, the occupiers would have all died then. We fired about 300 shells without knowing where. We were told the coordinates - we shot there. If the volumes that we fired at the beginning of the war were combined with such direct streams, which thanks to UAVs we have now, it would be possible to simply destroy any position, the officer explains. The military jokingly compares the 25th Sicheslav Airborne Brigade to Chip and Dale from the famous Disney cartoon about the chipmunks. After all, he says, the brigade is often sent to the direction where the biggest problems arise and where it is urgently necessary to -put out the fire-. — The first time this happened was in the Avdiivka region, when we were planned to be taken out for recovery and replaced by another brigade. Our units began to leave, but not even a day and a half passed when those who replaced us began to fall and lose positions. Therefore, we were forced to urgently return and save the situation, the officer says. Then many more times the Czechoslovak paratroopers were transferred to the hottest and most difficult areas of the front, and everywhere they provided the desired result - both in defense and in attack. -Khorunzhiy- fondly remembers the Slobozhan offensive operation, when the Defense Forces managed to liberate a huge territory of the Kharkiv region with a swift thrust. — When we were transferred to Kharkiv Oblast, there were very big doubts, but we fulfilled the assigned tasks and everything was successful. With minimal losses and with a huge amount of trophies, Raisin was liberated. Then, with already greater losses, unfortunately, they reached the Lyman, he says. The military believes that if it was then possible to introduce additional reserves, reinforce and replace the already exhausted Ukrainian military, the offensive could be continued. Victory in the war is just as achievable, he is convinced. For this, the two most important conditions are necessary - nationwide support of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and a sufficient number of motivated and well-trained soldiers. Photo by the author and from the archive of the 25th separate Sicheslav Airborne Brigade

Title: Order -Golden Star- and not only: ArmyInform about social protection Heroes of Ukraine
Description: This title is the highest state award given for heroic deeds. Along with the title, the Order of the -Gold Star- is awarded. Also, this title provides a number of additional payments and benefits. What social guarantees do the Heroes of Ukraine receive, ArmiyaInform tells. Heroes of Ukraine, who received the title for a heroic deed, can count on housing. Volodymyr Zelenskyi signed the relevant decree this year. The document states that one-time address assistance in the form of residential premises for permanent residence can be granted regardless of the presence of such persons on the register of citizens who need improvement of living conditions. Also, family members can receive such targeted assistance, if the title of Hero of Ukraine with the award of the -Golden Star- was awarded posthumously, or in the event of the death of a person who was awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine. If the title of Hero of Ukraine is awarded for a heroic deed, a one-time reward must be paid. According to Cabinet resolution, the amount of the award is 50 of the subsistence minimum established for able-bodied persons on January 1 of the calendar year in which the title is awarded. In 2024, it is 151 thousand 150 hryvnias. The payment can be received directly by the Hero of Ukraine. In the event that the title is awarded posthumously, the payment is divided equally among all family members. To receive a payment, you need to contact the Pension Fund of Ukraine and submit relevant documents: Also Ukrainian legislation provides monthly cash payments, in particular, to Heroes of Ukraine, who have been awarded the title of -Gold Star- since 2014. The amount of payment is 3 minimum wages established on January 1 of the calendar year. An application for receiving a payment must be submitted to the Pension Fund of Ukraine. In addition to housing and payments, Heroes of Ukraine receive a number of benefits from the state. The list is determined by Law of Ukraine -On the status of veterans war, guarantees of their social protection-. In particular, direct participants in the protection of the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine and who, since 2014, have been awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine with the awarding of the -Golden Star- order, are considered to have special merits for the Motherland. These people are entitled to a significant list of benefits: Financial: Medical: Housing and utilities: Transportation: This is not a complete a list of benefits granted for special services to the Motherland. Everything is described in more detail directly in the law.

Title: Heroes of Ukraine: ArmyInform found out in which branches of the army there are the most of them
Description: During the Russian-Ukrainian war, this honorary title gained special importance in the state. After all, heroism has become inseparable from sacrifice. He became something exceptional, extraordinary. As ArmiyaInform was informed by the Personnel Center of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, from the beginning of the Russian-Ukrainian war on February 20, 2014 to December 2, 2024, 449 servicemen were awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine (excluding the Military Intelligence Service and units under its direct control and the Military Intelligence Directorate of the Military Intelligence Service). Moreover, from 2014 to 2021, only 52 people were awarded the Golden Star, and starting from 2022, the number of awardees has more than doubled this number every year. The most Heroes of Ukraine in the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — 234 people, in the Airborne Assault Forces — 57, in the Air Force — 52, TrO of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — 39, SSO of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — 28, Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — 23. More about the distribution of the awarded by types and types of troops ( forces) — in the infographic We would like to remind that from May 2023, preliminary consideration of submissions and other materials on awarding the title of Hero of Ukraine for the performance of a remarkable heroic act by persons who took a direct part in the implementation of measures to ensure the defense of Ukraine, the protection of the safety of the population and the interests of the state, is carried out by an expert group. which is formed from representatives of all power structures.

Title: The occupiers created classes of young Russian Guardsmen at TOT
Description: About this informs Center of national resistance. In the temporarily occupied territories, the enemy pursues a policy of militarizing children in order to raise future janissaries from them in the future wars of the empire. In particular, the Russians invented classes of -young Russian Guardsmen-, which were supervised by the police. The children were given -cadet- uniforms and forced to swear allegiance to the occupiers. At the same time, they were given lectures by people who organize torture chambers and kidnap people from the streets. In the future, the children were promised benefits when entering specialized educational institutions. The Kremlin spent hundreds of years building a system in which service to a dictator or in the army is the only chance to build a career if you live in the provinces of the empire. In this way, Moscow ensures control over the captured lands and gains manpower for wars of aggression. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the occupied Luhansk Region they are planning to spend 43 billion rubles on the so-called development of the coal industry.

Title: Shahed hit a private house in Chernihiv Oblast
Description: This was reported by the head of Chernihiv OVA Vyacheslav Chaus. As a result of the attack, a local resident was injured and was hospitalized in a local hospital. All relevant services worked on the spot to eliminate the consequences and help. As reported by ArmyInform, the aggressor hit Nikopol region with kamikaze drones and artillery, a total of 15 attacks per day.

Title: Our drones destroyed the position of the occupiers by intercepting a video signal from an enemy UAV
Description: The video of the operation of our drones was published by the commander of NSU Oleksandr Pivnenko. The enemy drone, after working, returned to its base, which was a fatal mistake for the occupiers. Thanks to the received video, the National Guardsmen accurately determined the coordinates of the enemy's drone launch point and delivered a devastating blow to it with FPV drones. As reported by ArmyInform, unique footage of combat work with a foray into an enemy cell showed fighters of the 4th separate unit of the Omega Special Purpose Center.

Title: Volodymyr Zelensky presented the Gold Heart award and talked with Ukrainian volunteers
Description: About this it is stated on the website of the Head of State. -I congratulate you, all our Ukrainian volunteers, on International Volunteer Day. I want to thank you for your work, for your service. You give your life, first of all, to our fighters, warriors - to all those on whom the lives of each of us, our children, depend. I want to thank you for helping as much as possible both at the front and in civilian life,- said the President. Volodymyr Zelenskyy emphasized that the Ukrainian volunteer movement unites caring people who are always ready to help. The President presented the -Golden Heart- award to Volodymyr Alekseev, head of the Supervisory Board of the Public Organization -DOF-, Oleksandr Belyuza, head of the Public Organization -BELUGA UA-, Maria Berlinska, head of the Victory Drones project of the Dignitas Foundation, Lyubov Galan, co-founder of the Public Organization -Princip Human Rights Center-, volunteers Svitlana Zabava, head of the public union -Ukrainian network for children's rights-. Yevhen Kaplin of the public organization -PROLISKA-, Volodymyr Kolomaik, founder of the charitable organization -International Charitable Fund -UNITIUA-, Zhanna Lishchynska, co-founder and head of the board of the Zaporizhia Regional Public Organization -Peace and Protection of the Family-, volunteer of the charitable foundation -Volunteer Headquarters of the 5th Separate Kyiv assault brigade- Lyudmila Menuyk, head of the humanitarian department of the charitable organization -Serhiy Prytula Foundation- Maryna Petrychenko, head of the All-Ukrainian public organization -Knight's Cross- Oksana Tunik-Fryz, volunteer of the public union -Ukrainian Network for Children's Rights- Anastasia Khaliulova, volunteer of the charitable organization -Charitable Fund -Save Ukraine- Myroslava Kharchenko, director of the charity organization Charitable Foundation -Steel- to Tetiana Kharko, head of the public organization -Hardened hearts- Tetyana Khytriy and the members of the band -Kurgan and Aggregat- Amil Elman Ogla Nasirova, Ramil Elman Ogla Nasirova and Yevgenia Volodchenko, who organize large-scale gatherings for Ukrainian soldiers. Volodymyr Zelenskyi launched the -Golden Heart- award in 2022. Since then, every year on the International Volunteer Day, the President presents it to those who have made a significant contribution to the provision of volunteer assistance and the development of the volunteer movement. During the meeting, the Head of State discussed with representatives of the volunteer movement the provision of the Defense Forces, in particular the purchase of FPV drones and the strengthening of air defense, as well as the construction of fortifications. Separately, Volodymyr Zelenskyi spoke about the preparation of the first meeting of the Technological Stavka, which is to be held this month. In addition, the implementation of the initiative of the Head of State Bring Kids Back UA and specific steps for the return of Ukrainian children illegally deported by Russia were discussed. We remind you, Volodymyr Zelenskyi said that today is the 30th anniversary of the Budapest Memorandum. Ten years of war. This document has not worked for a single day.

Title: Rustem Umyerov discussed international military aid for Ukraine with attachés of partner countries
Description: This is stated in a post on the minister's Facebook page. The main topic of discussion is international military aid for Ukraine. -I expressed my sincere gratitude to every country that supports us in the fight against the aggressor. It is extremely important for Ukraine and our partners that the transferred weapons and equipment are used as efficiently as possible on the battlefield,- said Rustem Umyerov. Together with the representatives of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security, Defense and Intelligence, the participants of the meeting informed the military attachés about the digitalization of military aid records. Before the start of the full-scale Russian aggression, weapons records were kept exclusively in paper format. The Great War showed that such approaches need to be fundamentally changed. This year, the Ministry of Defense made significant progress in reforming the supply of weapons and equipment to NATO standards. One of the key achievements was the implementation of the SAP system, which translates the accounting and provision of the army into a modern digital format, convenient for analysis and control. Thanks to the license transferred by Germany, SAP is scalable to all units of the Defense Forces. Today, the system covers 3,000 users at the tactical, operational and strategic levels. About 300,000 items have already been entered into the database, and in the online mode we monitor key indicators: the number of weapons, their condition and distribution among units. -Such formats of meetings with the military attachés of our allies will be regular. At the next event, we plan to summarize the results of military aid for previous years and define support plans for 2025. Transparency, clarity and accountability are the principles that the Ministry of Defense steadfastly adheres to in cooperation with our allies,- Rustem Umyerov concluded.

Title: The invaders attacked Nikopol 15 times a day
Description: notifies the head of Dnipropetrovsk OVA Serhiy Lysak. The enemy aimed at Nikopol, Pokrovska, Marganetska, Chervonogrigorivska and Myrivska communities. Damaged infrastructure. 2 five-story buildings, 13 private houses, 11 farm buildings, 3 garages, a car and a scooter were damaged. 3 greenhouses were mutilated, one more was destroyed. Caught a gas pipeline. People were not injured. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Pokrovsky direction every day dozens of enemy attacks, however, the number of attack aircraft has changed — they have been drastically reduced.

Title: Effective guarantees are needed, a mere signature or promises are not enough for security — the Pres...
Description: He said this in his evening address. -Today is the 30th anniversary of the Budapest Memorandum. Ten years of war. This document has not worked for a single day. And because of this, everyone in the world will now know that just the signature of any state, some assurances or promises are not enough for security,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. The head of state also emphasized the need for timely supplies of weapons from Western partners. -Effective guarantees are needed. That is, a real alliance and a realistic security foundation within the country. A weapon that allows you to defend yourself and restrain the enemy. And unity, which helps to persevere even in the most difficult moments. We are working on each of the security elements. Thanks to everyone who helps! Thanks to all our people who provide all this,- he said.

Title: In the rear of the enemy: fighters of the special unit blew up a high-rise building with occupiers
Description: The video was published on the page of the National Guard of Ukraine. The building was occupied by enemy infantry, which had to be destroyed. They decided to do this by collapsing the entire structure directly on the occupiers. For this, the special forces approached the building with the enemy under cover of fire. In a matter of minutes, the house was filled with explosive devices, which detonated as soon as the fighters left. In this way, the special forces wished -good night to the occupiers-. In the video, you can hear the emotional cries of fighters who were a hair's breadth away from possible death. Omega aerial scouts recorded the result of the fighter's risky operation. Earlier, ArmyInform showed how fighters of the battalion of unmanned systems of the 63rd mechanized brigade -dron/->hit the occupier, who was carrying canisters with fuel.

Title: Crimes of the Russian army: more than 1,000 civilians have been blown up by landmines since the begi...
Description: This was reported by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. Kharkiv, Kherson and Mykolaiv regions remain the most polluted freed territories. Representatives of the Main Department of Mine Action, Civil Defense and Environmental Security of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine reported this at the fifth review conference (5RC) on the implementation of the Convention on the Prohibition of the Use, Stockpiling, Production and Transfer of Anti-Personnel Mines and Their Destruction, which was held in the Kingdom of Cambodia within the framework of the Siem Reap-Angkor summit. Representatives of 90 participating countries, 12 observer countries of the Ottawa Convention and almost 20 delegations of various international organizations took part in the event. The Ukrainian delegation told the international community in detail about the crimes of the Russian Federation related to the use of anti-personnel mines against the civilian population. The conference participants were also provided with information about shelling of humanitarian demining groups, which prevent the full implementation of mine action activities. In addition, it was informed about the measures to clean up the territories contaminated by Russian anti-personnel mines and the progress in this area that the units of the Ministry of Defense managed to achieve during 2024. Thus, during the non-technical survey, 35,000 km² of the territory was marked as not containing evidence of the presence of risks. This made it possible to reduce the area of ​​potentially contaminated areas from 174,000 to 139,000 km². As reported by ArmyInform, in 2024 in Ukraine 10 new demining battalions were created. In addition, the fleet of mechanized demining vehicles increased from two units to 52, of which 42 are in the Armed Forces and 10 are in the State Special Transport Service.

Title: In the Kherson region, three people were injured due to Russian shelling
Description: The Kherson Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about this. As of 17:30, it is known about three victims among the civilian population. A 53-year-old man was injured due to the dropping of explosives from a drone in Kherson. Under similar circumstances, a 51-year-old man was injured in Antonivka. Also, as a result of an enemy attack on the village of Tomyna Balka, a 67-year-old man received acupressure and shrapnel wounds. As a result of shelling, seven civilian objects were damaged in the Kherson region, including private and apartment buildings, cars, etc. Under the procedural guidance of the prosecutor's office of the Kherson region, an investigation into the facts of war crimes was launched (Part 1 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

Title: Increasing the ruble discount rate will not help and it will continue to fall
Description: About this notifies the Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine. The regulator allows its increase to 25% at the next meeting of the board of directors on December 20. Also, according to the statement of the Central Bank, the exchange rate has become a new -pro-inflationary factor-. Price growth remains high, and the slowdown in lending, in particular corporate lending, is recorded. It is unlikely that an increase in the discount rate will help the ruble. High inflation of 8.8% and an increase in the key rate in December create significant risks for the Russian economy. We are talking about a decrease in the purchasing power of the population, an increase in the cost of lending, an increase in the debt burden, etc. The war against Ukraine is finally bringing the Russian economy into the abyss. We remind you that the Russian authorities plan to allow the use of in harmful jobs in the industry of teenagers from the age of 16.
