According to Andriy Polukhin, the reason for the popular Russian tactics of -small infantry groups- is the work of our drones. That is why from 2 to 5 stormtroopers go into attacks. -In order for their forces to be invisible, they need to form small infantry groups, no more than a few men. They try to go to the rear and impose a battle there. Such sorties are not very pleasant for our defense, but still they do not decide, this is still a small infantry group,- noted Andriy Polukhin. Previously ArmyInform reported that the Russians are giving up their attempts to occupy the city of Chasiv Yar, the situation remains difficult.

Title: In the Pokrovsky direction, the Russian military shot five prisoners of the Armed Forces
Description: This is reported by the Office of the Prosecutor General. According to preliminary data, in November 2024, Russian troops stormed the positions of Ukrainian defenders near the village of Petrivka, Pokrovsky district. During the battle, five soldiers of the ZSU were forced to retreat and found shelter in a private house. After surrounding the building, the occupiers captured the Ukrainian military, forced them to leave the shelter without weapons and lie on the ground. Violating the norms of international humanitarian law, the Russian military shot the prisoners with automatic weapons. The pre-trial investigation is conducted according to h. 2 Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder). Investigative actions are ongoing, the circumstances of the crime and the persons involved in its commission are being established. We remind you that the killing of prisoners of war is a gross violation of the Geneva Conventions and is classified as a serious international crime. The investigation is carried out by the State Security Service of Ukraine in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers shot five people near Vugledara captured soldiers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Title: Operation -GUR-KIT-: scouts conducted an atypical evacuation of cats from Zmiiny Island
Description: informs about this on November 26, the Main Directorate of Intelligence of the IOM. It is noted that the approach of winter frost complicates the carefree life of numerous cats and kittens living on Zmiiny Island. -The kittens were carefully brought to Sirius, one of the largest animal shelters in Ukraine, and the rescue operation took place with the support of the MacPaw Foundation,- the scouts said. They emphasized that after the adaptation of the cats rescued from the famous Snake, everyone willing will have the opportunity to shelter one of them and take care of them at the Sirius shelter. -The head of the special service is known to love animals: he has cats Gunter and Snake, frog Peter and canaries. And in April 2022, after the de-occupation of Kyiv region, volunteers of the MacPaw Foundation were the first to bring feed and everything necessary for the care of animals to the -Sirius- shelter,- the scouts noted. The HUR called on those who care to do good and support the activities of Sirius shelter in winter. This is not the first time that the Defense Forces of Ukraine have rescued animals during the war. Earlier this year, during a combat operation in Kharkiv Oblast, servicemen of the 92nd OShBr -kyyivskomu-zooparku/->discoveredin a ruined house hungry owlets locked in a cage. The birds were rescued and handed over to the head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications of Ukraine Kyryl Budanov.

Title: Border guards stopped another conqueror of the Belarusian border
Description: About this informs State Border Service of Ukraine. According to preliminary information, the man studied the area, laid out routes that bypassed checkpoints, and directly accompanied persons trying to evade mobilization to the state border. In addition, the organizer sold information about these routes through messengers, in particular through Telegram channels. The arrest took place at the moment when the attacker tried to smuggle one of these persons across the border. During the searches, cash, mobile phones and other evidence of illegal activities were seized from him. Documentation of criminal activity was carried out by the investigative department of the Main Directorate of the National Police in the Chernihiv region. The detainee was declared suspicious for h. 3 Art. 332 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (illegal transportation of persons across the state border). According to the sanction of the article, he faces punishment in the form of imprisonment for a term of seven to nine years. Currently, the suspect has been taken into custody. Operative measures took place under the procedural leadership of the Chernihiv Regional Prosecutor's Office. Border guards of the 105th detachment continue to actively work on exposing similar criminal schemes, demonstrating determination in protecting the borders and security of Ukraine. Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in Kyiv and Kyiv region in cooperation with the Counterintelligence Department and together with the National Police under the procedural guidance of the Kyiv City Prosecutor's Office. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Propaganda postponed: the occupiers failed to launch the -education center-
Description: This was reported by Artem Lysohor, head of the Luhansk OVA. According to him, on paper all the work is supposedly completed, but the occupiers have not yet decided on the final date for the start of propaganda activities. Lysohor noted that show repairs even in propaganda centers are part of the corrupt practices of the occupation regime. On the way out of Siversko-Donetsk in the direction of Luhansk, the invaders significantly increased vehicle checks. Occupiers carefully check the documents of drivers and passengers, as well as search luggage compartments. Because of this, traffic was significantly complicated, which caused long queues. The purpose of such inspections remains unknown, as the occupiers do not disclose the results of these raids. The situation in the occupied territories of Luhansk region remains difficult, and the actions of the invaders only cause new difficulties for the local population. As reported by ArmyInform, in the so-called LNR decided to reduce the number of employees of the emergency medical service, which caused the indignation of local residents.

Title: Scattered like cockroaches - our drones finished off the Russian landing force
Description: The video of combat work appeared on November 26 on the brigade's channel. Enemy BMPs were stopped by mines, after which the paratroopers tried to hide in the landing. But our pilots were already waiting there, who arranged a real knockout of the enemy. -With precise strikes, we destroy the enemy BMP, and then the hunt begins for the infantry, which runs away in panic. Accurate drops from the sky and FPV remind the occupiers that there is no place for them on Ukrainian soil,- the brigade commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 60th mechanized Ingulets brigade showed the destruction of the Russians who decided to attack on -Niva- passenger cars, protected only by camouflage and EW.

Title: Donetsk is at the epicenter of the fire: shelling killed a person and destroyed infrastructure
Description: reported this by the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin. In the village of Dachne of the Kurakhiv community, one person died as a result of shelling, five houses were destroyed, and another 14 were damaged. Six buildings were damaged in Hannivka. Three houses were destroyed by shelling in Myrnograd. Seven buildings were damaged in Pokrovsk, three more were damaged in the village of Shevchenko. In Pishchany, shelling caused the destruction of an enterprise, and in Malynivka of the Grodiv community, two houses were damaged. In Illinivska hromad, one person was wounded by shelling, three infrastructure objects were damaged in the village of Zorya, and 18 in Popovoy Yar. Two private houses were damaged in Siversk. In the Chasovoyarsk community, 11 private houses, two high-rise buildings and a non-residential building were destroyed. Over the past day, 162 people, including 22 children, were evacuated from the front-line territories of Donetsk region. As reported by ArmyInform, the S-400 attack on Kharkiv: 26 injured, dozens of buildings damaged.

Title: The SBU detained a Russian agent who wanted to blow up a police outfit in the center of Kyiv
Description: This is reported by the Security Service of Ukraine. That day, a police team arrived on a call about domestic violence in an apartment building in the Pechersk district of the capital. During the attempt of the law enforcement officers to enter the house at the entrance to the premises, the so-called -stretcher- with an F-1 grenade went off. As it turned out, no one lived in the apartment, and the -call- by a female voice to the 102 line was a fake to trap and kill the police. According to SBU materials, this terrorist attack was planned by Russian special services. For its implementation, they remotely engaged a 43-year-old resident of Kyiv region, who had already served 6 sentences for robbery, theft and escaping from prison. Before installing the -stretcher-, the agent performed a -test- task: he set fire to the relay box of Ukrzaliznytsia on the outskirts of the capital and sent the relevant videos to the curator. After that, the recidivist received step-by-step instructions for committing a terrorist attack against Ukrainian law enforcement officers. The attacker rented an apartment in the center of Kyiv, installed a -stretcher- there with a live grenade, as well as video cameras that were supposed to record the detonation in real time. Thanks to the professional actions of the police, no one was injured during the explosion. Soon after, law enforcement officers arrested the person involved in hot pursuit. During searches of the detainee's premises, a mobile phone, SIM cards and clothes with evidence of criminal activities were seized. Investigators of the Security Service informed the accused about the suspicion for h. 2 Art. 258 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (terrorist act). The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to 12 years in prison with confiscation of property. As reported by ArmyInform, the guard dog of the occupiers: a traitor in epaulettes who switched to the side of Russia was exposed.

Title: When scary fairy tales come to life: Russians are hunted simultaneously by -Yaga women- and -vampire...
Description: Stepan Barna, commander of the unit, told about this on the air of -Social News-. -Barney- of the 10th Separate Mountain Assault Brigade -Edelweiss-. According to Stepan Barna, the losses do not stop the occupiers — they continue to storm in small groups supported by artillery and aviation. The defenders respond to them - our drones especially annoy the occupiers. -FPV drones, Baba Yaga drones - which provide support on our side of the front. Therefore, it is obvious that the enemy is trying to find the positions of unmanned forces and destroy them. Our task is to disguise ourselves as much as possible and continue to stop the enemy on his tricks,- Stepan Barna said. How reported ArmyInform, in the Seversky direction due to the weather, -foot assaults- are becoming more difficult - the occupiers will have to use equipment and drones.

Title: Death by night - the Azovians hunt the invaders in the dark
Description: The video of combat work appeared on the brigade channel. Operators of attack drones guarantee peace to the enemy only after his final death. Therefore, work in the dark is aimed at maximum damage to any actions of the personnel of the occupiers. -Everything is flying at the heads of the Russians: from grenades and VOGs to TMok and cluster munitions,- the brigade commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the soldiers of the 12th special purpose brigade -Azov- of the National Guard first force Russian soldiers to crawl into the ground, and then destroyed.

Title: A million drones for the front: Ukraine exceeded the presidential plan
Description: This declared the Deputy Prime Minister for Innovation, Education, Science and Technology, Minister of Digital Transformation of Ukraine Mykhailo Fedorov. -The main task of the state is to provide the Defense Forces with everything they need. Do you need drones? So, drones. Do you need new technologies? Launching Brave1 and building a Technology Stake,- he noted. Mykhailo Fedorov emphasized that Ukrainians have proven their ability to act in concert, achieving ambitious goals. As an example, according to the President's task, it was planned to put a million drones on the front for a year, and this figure has already been exceeded. A key focus is technological superiority on the battlefield. The coordinated work of the Ministry of Digital, the Ministry of Defense, the State Special Communications, the Office of the President, the Ministry of Strategy and Industry and the General Staff is aimed at one common goal - the protection of the country. The minister emphasized that the state institutions will scale the successes in the introduction of drones to other areas of technological warfare. At the same time, he urged to avoid rumors, scandals and attempts to create conflicts between structures. -Unity has been Ukraine's greatest asset since February 24, and it will continue to be so. Our task is to work together for victory, each in his own place,- concluded Mykhailo Fedorov. Ukraine continues to strengthen its defense capabilities thanks to new technologies and cohesion. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine is looking for innovative technologies for combating the aggressor's drones.

Title: Ten Russians at the Kobzon concert — an impressive raid performed by our special forces
Description: The video of the combat work of special forces was published on the unit's channel. During a raid in a forest area, special forces encountered enemy infantry and destroyed it with aimed fire. The bodies of the slain enemies were recorded on camera. -During a light walk, UA_REG minus 10 orcs,- the unit commented on the video.   As reported by ArmyInform, the fighters of the UA_REG Team unit of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces demonstrated numerous hits on Russians during the battles in the Kursk region.

Title: S-400 attack on Kharkiv: 26 injured, dozens of buildings damaged
Description: reported this by Oleg Synegubov, the head of Kharkiv OVA. As a result of shelling from the S-400 complex, more than 40 buildings and 5 cars were damaged. 26 people were injured. Fragments of a downed Shahed drone were found in a field near the village of Dokuchayeva. According to the head of the OVA, in the village of Kotlyari, an enemy UAV strike caused a fire in the tire fitting building. Three private households were damaged in the Dergachiv community in the village of Slatine. In the Kupyan district, an educational institution building, four residential buildings and one administrative building were damaged as a result of an attack by guided aerial bombs (UAB). Another KAB hit an open area outside the village. In the city of Kupyansk, a drone struck near an educational institution. A 66-year-old man was injured and hospitalized. As a result of the aggravation of the situation, 51 people were evacuated from the Kupyanskyi and Borivskyi directions. We will remind, the number of victims as a result of the Russian attack in Kharkiv on Monday increased. As reported by ArmyInform, a man died as a result of drone attacks in the Mykolaiv Region.

Title: Ministry of Defense: An interdepartmental commission is investigating the causes of the abnormal act...
Description: About this Ministry of Defense reported November 26. -The absence of comments in the public space does not mean that the Ministry of Defense is inactive or does not respond to information that comes from the military or appears, in particular, in the mass media. At the same time, the Ministry of Defense works in a closed perimeter to ensure maximum efficiency and security. Because of the ongoing Russian aggression, information about the progress of the work is sensitive, so it remains with limited access,- the statement of the Ministry of Defense said. According to his data, the use of the specified batches of ammunition in the Defense Forces, as well as their issuance to combat units, is currently suspended until completion of determining the causes of abnormal operation. The batch of delivered ammunition has been withdrawn for further research. Instead, imported mines will be supplied. Preliminary results of the investigation of the interagency commission into the supply of low-quality 120-mm mortar mines indicate possible causes of defects, in particular, low-quality powder charges or violations of ammunition storage conditions, which led to their damage. According to this fact, the State Bureau of Investigation started criminal proceedings. According to the results of the work of the interdepartmental commission, appropriate personnel decisions will be made regarding the responsible officials. The Ministry of Defense emphasizes that it is the customer of the specified type of weapons for the Defense Forces. At the same time, the executor of the state order is the Ministry of Strategic Industries. Currently, the Ministry of Defense has defined measures to improve the quality control process. It is about strengthening the monitoring of storage conditions and improving inspection procedures at all stages: from production and storage to delivery to the front line. Also, the interagency commission will conduct an inspection of mortar mines of other calibers for compliance with production standards, quality of components and their storage conditions. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine expands tools procurement financing to provide the Armed Forces with modern and latest military equipment.

Title: Another important object of the enemy was hit by our artillery
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. However, our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying troops and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear. Over the past 24 hours, missile troops and artillery of the Defense Forces hit the personnel concentration area, five control points and another important enemy object. We will remind, last day the losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1480 people. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 6 tanks, 20 armored combat vehicles, 19 artillery systems, 72 operational-tactical UAVs, a cruise missile, 94 vehicles and 2 units of special equipment. As reported by ArmyInform, the situation at the front is difficult: The Armed Forces stopped more than 190 Russian assaults.

Title: -Move quickly!- GUR recorded the conversations of North Korean soldiers in Kurshchyna
Description: Radio intercept recording released on November 26 by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. -Get out quickly! Move back quickly, quickly!- - said a military man on the radio in Korean. GUR reminds that there will be a just retribution for every war crime committed against the Ukrainian people. As reported by ArmyInform, GUR showed drones that attacks military objects of the aggressor.

Title: Russian troops shelled the critical infrastructure of the Kherson region, there are victims
Description: This was notified by the head of Kherson OVA Oleksandr Prokudin. Stanislav, Berislav, Sofiivka, Tyaginka, Mykhailivka, Antonivka, Chervyn Mayak, Shiroka Balka, Tomarine, Kachkarivka, Komyshany, Olhivka, Prydniprovske, Sadove, Naddniprianske and the city of Kherson came under enemy fire and airstrikes last day. According to the head of the OVA, the Russian military hit the critical infrastructure and residential quarters of the populated areas of the region, in particular damaged 2 high-rise buildings, 8 private houses. The occupiers also mutilated a farm building and a private car. According to information of Khersonska ODA, around seven o'clock in the morning, Russian soldiers attacked a resident of Berislav. As a result of dropping explosives from the UAV, a 59-year-old man received a mine-explosive injury, injuries to his face and head. As reported by ArmyInform, during the day the occupiers struck 285 12 settlements of the Zaporizhzhia region. A 74-year-old man was injured as a result of Russian attacks in Pologiv district.

Title: Almost two hundred UAVs - the enemy released a record number of drones
Description: On the morning of November 26 the Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported the results of the night attack of the Russians. Unfortunately, critical infrastructure objects are hit, and private and apartment buildings are damaged in several regions due to a mass UAV attack. Previously, there were no victims or victims. On the night of November 26, 2024 (from 7:30 p.m. on November 25), the invaders attacked Ukraine with Iskander-M ballistic missiles from the Voronezh and Kursk regions. During the night attack, the enemy launched a record number of Shahed-type attack UAVs and unmanned aerial vehicles of an unknown type from the directions of Orel, Bryansk, Kursk, Primorsko-Akhtarsk - Russian Federation. 192 air targets were detected and escorted by the radio engineering troops of the Air Force: — 4 -Iskander-M- ballistic missiles; — 188 enemy unmanned aerial vehicles. Aviation, anti-aircraft missile units, electronic warfare equipment and mobile fire groups of the Air Force and Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the attack. As of 09:00, air defense shot down 76 enemy drones in Kyiv, Cherkasy, Kirovohrad, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv, Poltava, Zhytomyr, Khmelnytskyi, Vinnytsia, Chernivtsi, Ternopil, Rivne, Zaporizhia, Dnipropetrovsk, Odesa, and Mykolaiv regions. As reported by ArmyInform, in the South shot down the Iskander-M missile and five reconnaissance UAVs.

Title: In Ternopil, the Russians hit an energy facility
Description: This was reported on November 26 by the Ternopil Regional State Administration. -Fortunately, there are no human victims. Firefighters and police are on the scene. Relevant services are working to eliminate the problem,- said the message of the Ternopil Regional State Administration. According to data of Mayor Serhii Nadal, trolleybuses and elevators are currently not working in the city. As reported by ArmyInform, a man was killed as a result of drone attacks in Mykolayiv Oblast a>.

Title: Infernal hundreds are going to the ground: in the Pokrovsky direction, Russian invaders are being di...
Description: Serhiy Tsekhotskyi, officer 59, told about this on the air -Social News- of a separate mechanized brigade named after Yakov Handziuk. According to Serhiy Tsehotskyi, on average, the soldiers of their brigade eliminate 113 occupiers every day. At the same time, the robot against the enemy's rear is particularly effective against assaults. -Every day we liquidate one or another piece of equipment in their rear areas as close as possible. The equipment with which they try to go on assaults is used to transport personnel or to work somewhere from closed positions around us. This work in the complex is carried out constantly,- noted Serhii Tsehotskyi. How reported ArmyInform, in the Pokrovsky direction the enemy increased the number of attacks - respectively his losses increased.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , decree: to start a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: Five or six assaults per day — the Russians continue to press on the Pokrovsky direction
Description: Lieutenant Yuliya Stepaniuk, head of the communications department of the 117th heavy mechanized brigade, told on the ArmyTV stream about this. -It can be 10-15, sometimes 20 people. First, FPV drones work on them, then resets, then the infantry joins in: machine guns, mortars. And we can have 5-6 such assaults per day. One can only imagine the scale of this influx, which is approaching,- noted Yuliya Stepaniuk. According to her, from time to time the enemy also engages armored vehicles, in particular tanks, which work on our positions. But the 117th brigade in its area of ​​responsibility maintains the defense. As reported by ArmyInform, a quarter of all attacks the enemy fell on the Pokrovsky direction.

Title: A man died as a result of drone attacks in the Mykolayiv region
Description: This was reported by the head of Mykolaivska OVA Vitaly Kim. During the day of November 25, the enemy attacked the Kutsurub community four times with FPV drones. One of the shellings occurred in the village of Solonchaky during the distribution of humanitarian aid. As a result of the attack, six people were injured, including two representatives of the humanitarian mission and four local residents. Unfortunately, the 30-year-old man, who was in a serious condition, died at the hospital. The other victims are in stable condition. On the same day, at 4:34 p.m., the water area of ​​the Ochakiv community came under enemy artillery fire. There are no casualties. In addition, on the night of November 26, four UAVs of the Shahed 131/136 type were destroyed in the Mykolaiv Oblast by air defense forces and means. We will remind you that the enemy ->a drone attacked people during the distribution of humanitarian aid in the Mykolayiv region: there are wounded. As reported by ArmyInform, during the day the occupiers struck 285 12 settlements of the Zaporizhzhia region. A 74-year-old man was injured as a result of Russian attacks in Pologiv district.

Title: A difficult situation at the front: the Armed Forces stopped more than 190 Russian assaults
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Yesterday, the enemy hit the positions of Ukrainian units and populated areas with five missile strikes, using seven missiles, as well as 65 airstrikes, dropping 96 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, it carried out more than 4,450 attacks on populated areas and the positions of our troops, 112 of them from rocket salvo fire systems, and engaged about one and a half thousand kamikaze drones for destruction. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of the settlements of Stepok, Pavlivka, Yablunivka, Mala Rybytsia, Vovchanski Khutory, Velikiy Burluk, Pitomnyk, Mali Prohody, Chervona Zorya, Okip, Slatine, Kupyansk, Kruglyakivka, Bohuslavka, Ivanivka, Minkivka, Slov' Yansk, Grodivka, Dachne, Bogatyr, Velika Novosilka, Novy Komar, Olhivka In the Kharkiv direction Russian terrorists unsuccessfully stormed the positions of Ukrainian units five times in the Vovchansk, Kudiivka and Kozacha Lopan districts. Bomber and attack aircraft were actively engaged for strikes in the direction. In the Kupyan direction, 23 attacks by invaders took place during the day. The defense forces repelled enemy assaults near Novomlynsk, Kolisnykyvka, Zagryzovy, Synkivka, Lozova, Kruglyakivka, and Zeleny Gayu. In the Lyman direction, the invaders attacked the positions of our defenders eleven times. They tried to penetrate our defenses near Grekivka, Novoehorivka, Yampolivka, and Torsky. In the Kramatorsk direction, the occupiers attacked four times in the Chasovoy Yar and Stupochky areas. Over the past day, in the Toretsk direction, the occupiers stormed the positions of our defenders six times in the Toretsk, Dachnoi, and Shcherbinivka districts. One battle is still going on. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 51 offensive actions of the aggressor in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Hryhorivka, Petrivka, Dachenske, Pushkine and Pustinka settlements. In the Kurakhiv direction the defense forces repelled 46 attacks. The occupiers most actively tried to advance near Sontsivka, Berestki, Zori, Novodmytrivka, Dalny, Kurakhovo, Uspenivka, Elizavetivka, and Hannivka. In the Vremivsk direction, the enemy carried out 13 assaults on our positions in the districts of Rivnopol, Novodarivka, Kostiantynopolski and Sukhy Yaliv. In the Orichivsk direction, the enemy twice attacked the positions of our defenders near Novoandriivka last day. Three times, the invaders unsuccessfully tried to dislodge units of the Defense Forces from their positions on the Dnieper direction. In the Volyn and Poliske directions no signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. We will remind, last day the losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1480 people. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 6 tanks, 20 armored combat vehicles, 19 artillery systems, 72 operational-tactical UAVs, a cruise missile, 94 vehicles and 2 units of special equipment.

Title: Veni, vidi, twice! — two Russian soldiers were hunted in Kurshchyna
Description: The video of combat work appeared on November 26 on the page of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Operators of the 73rd Maritime Center of the SSO raided enemy positions in the Kursk region. During the shooting battle, two servicemen of the Russian army were successfully eliminated. ArmyInform talked about the fact that special forces captured important prisoners.

Title: The enemy keeps a missile carrier in the Black Sea: there is a threat of a strike
Description: This was reported by the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. There are no enemy ships in the Sea of ​​Azov. There are no enemy ships in the Mediterranean. During the day in the interests of the Russian Federation, passage through the Kerch Strait was carried out: The Russian Federation continues to violate the International Convention on the Protection of Life at Sea of ​​1974. (SOLAS) by disabling automatic identification systems. As reported by ArmyInform, russia is forced to raise large forces for air defense and other military infrastructure to maintain control over the temporarily occupied Crimea.

Title: The occupiers hit Zaporizhzhia 285 times: there is one injured
Description: This was reported by Ivan Fedorov, the head of Zaporizhzhya OVA. Russian troops carried out an air strike on Novodarivka. In addition, 148 UAVs of various modifications attacked Lobkovo, Primorske, Gulyaipole, Novoandriivka, Shcherbaki, Novodanilivka, Mala Tokmachka, Malynivka, Biloghirya, Novodarivka, and Olgivske. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy poraneni/->a drone attacked people during the distribution of humanitarian aid in the Mykolaiv region: there are wounded.

Title: Two dozen BBMs and almost 1,500 infantrymen: the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine announ...
Description: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine informs about this. The total combat losses of the enemy from February 24, 2022 to November 26, 2024 are estimated to be: prorvaty-oboronu-nashyh-vijsk/->The Ukrainian Armed Forces stopped 185 attempts by the Russians break through the defense of our troops.

Title: The Armed Forces stopped 185 attempts by the Russians to break through the defense of our troops
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The invaders launched three missile strikes on the territory of Ukraine with three missiles, 47 airstrikes, shot down 63 anti-aircraft missiles, and also used 647 kamikaze drones. At the same time, the enemy fired 3,360 shots at the positions of our troops and settlements. In the Kharkiv direction the enemy stormed the positions of our units near Vovchansk, Kudiivka and Kozacha Lopan five times. the enemy carried out an airstrike with a KAB on Pytomnik. 23 times the enemy stormed the positions of the Ukrainian military in the Kupyansk direction near Novomlynsk, Kolisnykyvka, Zagryzovy, Synkivka, Lozova, Kruglyakivka and Zeleny Gay. The enemy dropped aerial bombs in the areas of Velikiy Burluk, Kupyansk, Kruglyakivka and Boguslavka settlements. In the Lyman direction, the Russian invaders tried to advance 11 times in the districts of Grekivka, Novoyehorivka, Yampolivka, and Torsky. The defenders of Ukraine steadfastly hold the defense, inflicting significant losses on the enemy. The enemy carried out an airstrike by KABs on Ivanovka. In the Kramatorsk direction the enemy tried to advance four times in the areas of Stupochka and Chasiv Yar settlements. Minskivka and Slovyansk were hit by airstrikes. On the Toretsk direction the aggressor attacked six times near Toretsk, Dachny and Shcherbinivka. Currently, three clashes are ongoing. The Pokrovsky direction maintains a high intensity of hostilities. The number of clashes has increased to 51. The invaders continue to attack our positions near the settlements of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Hryhorivka, Petrivka, Dachenske, Pushkine and Pustinka. On the outskirts of Grodivka, the enemy carried out an airstrike by NARs. Previous losses of the aggressor 350 occupiers were killed and wounded in this direction. Two tanks, three motorcycles, a mortar, four cars were also destroyed, while two more cars and a motorcycle were damaged. In the Kurakhiv direction there were 45 combat clashes of varying intensity. The occupiers most actively tried to advance in the Sontsivka, Berestki, Zori, Novodmytrivka, Dalny, Kurakhovo, Uspenivka, Elizavetivka, and Hannivka districts. One skirmish continues. In the Vremivsk direction the aggressor stormed the front edge of our defense 13 times in the area of ​​Rivnopol, Novodarivka, Kostiantynopolski and Sukhy Yali. In the Orikhov direction, the enemy twice stormed our positions in the Novoandriivka area. In the Dnieper direction three attacks by the occupiers failed. However, the Defense Forces are holding back the onslaught of the Russian invaders. The department honored the soldiers of the 28th separate mechanized brigade named after the Knights of the Winter Campaign, the 100th separate mechanized brigade, the 14th operational brigade named after Ivan Bohun, the 425th separate assault battalion, the 118th separate mechanized brigade, the 126th separate brigade of Territorial Forces defenders who bravely hold their positions, skillfully repulse enemy attacks, inflict significant losses on the invaders. As reported by ArmyInform, soldiers of the 60th separate mechanized Ingulets brigade showed footage of the recent repelling the second wave of the Russian assault using equipment and infantry.

Title: What are the advantages of the corps-brigade system: an expert on the new concept of reorganization ...
Description: This may also mean how much the military management system will improve, said military expert Petro Chernyk: -We have a major combat unit, a brigade. However, we understand that the brigade does not fight by itself, considering the fact that we have a huge section of the front with a total length of about a thousand kilometers. Some number of brigades are fighting. The next control body that appears is the so-called tactical group, which can include 7-8 combat brigades. This is where the first problem appears. The command of the tactical group is a collective mess. This is not a permanent unit, it is temporary. There is a constant rotation of officers, which can actually reduce the quality of combat management of such large units. Therefore, we came to the conclusion that a full-time corps should be organized.- A corps can be anywhere from 4 to 7 brigades with the entire command network deployed. Why did they bypass the division link? A divisional unit is 3-4 brigades and is a duplicating body. There, again, a bunch of commanders, a bunch of operatives are needed there, they will be engaged in nothing but dubbing of the corps link. Could it have gone the divisional route? No. In my opinion, this is counterproductive. The conditional corps is 6-7 brigades. These are two divisions. So, instead of one corps level, there would be two divisional levels, which in the end creates a shortage of officers for such a large number of troops. What is the world practice? And so and so. Let's say the United States has the 101st Scalloping Eagles. But it is more of a historical character, because the divisional system justified itself well in the Second World War. But there are nuances. Both the Soviet Union, Nazi Germany, and the Allies had such a gigantic number of troops, so they could afford it. We cannot afford it. Plus, we understand that this is also funding for a potential division link.

Title: From the police to the Armed Forces: the instructor - Oak - told why every policeman should pass the...
Description: ArmyInform, a military officer spoke about the choice of each police officer, the danger of a logical trap due to euphoria or despair when consuming information about the war from the media, as well as why every adult citizen of Ukraine is obliged to pass the BZVP. Dub met the large-scale invasion in the ranks of the National Police. Took part in military operations on the territory of Zhytomyr and Kyiv regions. After the enemy was pushed beyond the borders of Zhytomyr and Kyiv regions, he resigned from the National Police and joined the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Subsequently, -Dub- took part in military operations in the Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, and Donetsk regions. In particular, he fought in the Bakhmut direction in the areas of Avdiivka, Klishchiivka, and Kurdyumivka. — I was injured there, after which I learned to walk again. And after rehabilitation, I was offered a position at a training center so that I could share my practical experience and teach as many new recruits as possible to perform their duties well, says the instructor. He adds that at that time he was not sure that he would be able to perform combat tasks due to his health, so he decided to transfer. Now, after recovery, he again submitted a report for transfer to a combat unit. — Some of my former police colleagues also joined the ranks of the Armed Forces, others continue to serve in the National Police. This is a worthy choice, because if all police officers resign and go to the Armed Forces, then there will be chaos in the rear. -Policemen in the rear are necessary,- says the soldier, answering a question about whether all police officers should go to war. He adds that training as a police officer is not enough to immediately become a soldier. -Oak- points out that the specifics of the work of the National Police in the rear, and even of the special police officers, are the detention of small groups of criminals armed with small arms and the release of hostages, and not at all combat operations inherent in modern warfare. — The level of training of National Police employees is not comparable to the level required in the Armed Forces. The skills and abilities of a police officer are not enough to participate in combat operations using FPV drones, artillery, tanks and other numerous means of fire damage that they want to kill you with, the military emphasizes. He is convinced that police officers need just as much intensive training during BZVP as anyone else. After all, modern war requires fundamentally different knowledge, abilities and skills than even special police officers from specialized units have. So police officers have to retrain and relearn a lot. — Being -at zero-, I would not want to worry that something bad might happen to my family. Therefore, I rely on my police colleagues who continue to serve in the rear. Their work and labor is also needed, -Dub- emphasizes. However, at the same time, he notes that rear-line policemen must be trained for combat operations even if they continue to serve in the rear. — In my personal opinion, it may well happen when they will also have to become servicemen of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, will have to take up weapons, not just automatic weapons. Therefore, all Ukrainians should receive at least minimal military training, the instructor is convinced. Similarly, he believes, basic general military training of all civilians should be provided. This does not mean that everyone who has it will go to the front or even serve in the Armed Forces. However, everyone should have a minimum set of knowledge and skills in order to be able to defend Ukraine in case of need. -Oak- explains its position with personal experience. He is convinced that the availability of basic knowledge helped him a lot in the first months of the great war, becoming the basis for the further acquisition and improvement of the abilities and skills of a serviceman. — I expected that I would have to defend Ukraine with weapons in my hands, and I was preparing for it, because I understood that a big war would definitely happen. He tried to learn, learn information about weapons, about the tactics of action in small groups, studied topography, orientation on the terrain. He prepared little by little, he says. That is why everyone should be at least minimally prepared for hostilities, because with such a neighbor as the Russian Federation, there will always be a danger of new aggression and renewed hostilities. - Now our population has relaxed, started to lose the sense of danger that was in the first months of the large-scale invasion. It seems to many that the war is somewhere far away, and therefore will not affect them personally. It is very dangerous to think like that, - the former policeman is convinced, because the war is actually very close, and has already affected, and continues to determine the life of every Ukrainian. -Dub- puts a significant share of responsibility for this attitude of Ukrainians towards the war on the media and the state information policy aimed at reassuring people and the promise of a quick end to the war and easy victories. — -Two or three weeks, two or three months - and we will win. We have liberated Kherson and will soon enter the Crimea!-. After hearing this, people began to believe that they are no longer needed in the army, because what is the point of changing your life, joining the army, if victory will soon come without you? he asks rhetorically. Due to excessive optimism in the presentation of information about the war, Ukrainians began to distance themselves from the topic of the war and stopped following what was happening at the front. Because they believed that the Armed Forces of Ukraine would handle everything perfectly without their personal involvement. And then there was a -distortion- in the opposite direction - they began to tell that everything was bad and that Russia was still winning. Therefore, people began to get the impression that their participation would not change anything. In fact, the military man is convinced, only the joint efforts of the entire society, the entire country — all Ukrainians and women need to make efforts to win. - Many people are afraid to join the army because they believe that they will be thrown into the trenches, and they will, let's say, always sit in the trenches - in the mud, in the mud, in the cold. It's not like the army is functioning at all, a lot of specialists are needed, including logistics, clerks, cooks, drivers, and repairmen, the instructor explains. Therefore, in the Armed Forces there will be a place for everyone within the limits of his specialty and abilities. The decision to join the army, he believes, does not mean the end of life, but rather becomes a new stage in it. The extent to which a recruit will be able to realize himself in the Armed Forces will depend on him. - This is what I tell the servicemen who come to our unit for training - that they need to learn, to be able to do everything. But I draw their attention to the fact that not all of them will necessarily become stormtroopers or fight on the front lines, the instructor explains. At the same time, everyone who joins the army must pass the BZVP, because there can always be an urgent need to join the battle for everyone - as it was in February 2022, when everyone stood in lines for weapons, regardless of civilian profession and having military experience. - In 2022, no one paid attention to the civilian profession - it was necessary to take up arms and defend one's land. Because of this, basic general military training is now conducted to ensure that everyone has general combat skills. Then the fighters are sent to professional training depending on where they will be assigned, -Dub- explains. He emphasizes that, already during the BZVP at the training center, the instructors find out what education, skills and skills the recruits have from their previous civilian experience. This allows them to be recommended for exactly those positions where they can be most effective in the ranks of the Armed Forces, and therefore useful for the defense of Ukraine. — We can make recommendations to which position to assign a particular serviceman in order to make the most effective use of their skills that they have acquired throughout their lives working in civilian professions, so that they can be as effective as possible in the ranks of the Armed Forces, the instructor says. — We communicate directly with the brigades of the airborne assault troops that are on the front line, we exchange training recommendations. They make certain corrections, recommendations on training, on the necessary practical or theoretical knowledge that is actually needed on the front line, - says -Dub-. Thanks to this, the training is structured in such a way as to give the maximum necessary knowledge and not to overload the cadet with secondary information, not to take his time and energy for unnecessary things that will not be needed during the service. - From the statutes, we study only the most necessary, and we almost completely reject military training, since there is no practical need for it. We have instructors and officers with combat experience, they understand very well what is needed, what knowledge needs to be invested, - explains the instructor. He notes that the BZVP is the foundation on which each soldier will then be able to build his knowledge depending on the needs of his future position in the ranks of the Armed Forces. - My conscience does not allow me to teach them badly, because their lives depend on how I teach them. If one of them gets injured or dies in the future, I take it on my own account in the sense that I did not teach them well, that I did not give them a certain amount of information, a certain amount of theoretical or practical skills, did not motivate, did not brought something necessary, - says -Oak-. Currently, the soldier is already completing rehabilitation and has submitted a report for transfer to a combat position, because he believes that soon he will be able to be more effective on the front line. — My rehabilitation is already coming to an end, I understand for myself that I am ready to perform combat tasks, that I can lead people with me. Therefore, I am preparing to be transferred or seconded to a combat brigade in the near future, and there to perform my duties directly on the battlefield.

Title: All-weather beam-protector: a high-energy laser weapon system was presented to the US Army
Description: As stated in the annotation to this project, the text of which posted on the official portal of the developer firm, FIREFLY is designed to combat the growing asymmetric threats associated with with unmanned systems, and is a significant technological breakthrough in the field of air defense, ArmyInform reports. The system has a mobile and pallet (for stationary deployment) design with a modular architecture and scalable power (from 5 kW to 40 kW), specially designed to protect forward positions and critical infrastructure. The FIREFLY combat mechanism (-Svitlyak-, -Svitlyachok- in Ukrainian) is designed on the basis of a universal open architecture, optimized to balance performance, reliability, serviceability and portability. Thanks to modular replaceable units (LRUs), the system adapts to a wide range of operational applications and provides the flexibility to configure, customize and upgrade its capabilities as needs arise. This design allows FIREFLY to interact with C3S computer systems, such as FAAD (Forward Area Air Defense, -Forward Area Air Defense- - Ukrainian) and MEDUSA (Advanced Technology System for Small Unmanned Aerial Vehicles) and other autonomous detection systems (such as radars and optical sensors). The modular structure also facilitates maintenance at the intermediate and field levels, reducing operating costs by using low-cost, commercially available components. To provide target tracking, FIREFLY is equipped with an ISR (surveillance systems) payload, which includes independent visible and infrared surveillance systems, as well as advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities for remote threat detection and classification. One of the key advantages of this system, according to the experts of the Army Recognition defense portal, is its ability to work continuously for a long time. This allows the FIREFLY to neutralize multiple targets without the need for frequent reloads or reloads. Such indicators are critical when fending off massive attacks from multiple drones or other similar aerial threats. FIREFLY's functionality has undergone 34 months of rigorous testing, demonstrating its adaptability in challenging environments, including testing in temperatures from −15°C to 35°C, as well as challenging weather conditions such as heavy rain, snow, and sandstorms. The weapon was deployed on both fixed and unprepared sites, which confirmed its adaptability and ease of transport and deployment. This high-energy laser system is designed to be cost-effective with minimal logistical support thanks to simplified maintenance processes. KORD specialists focused on reducing production costs and delivery times by using commercially available components, ensuring increased reliability and rapid availability of fully ready-to-deploy units. FIREFLY is offered on competitive commercial terms, making it the perfect solution for armed forces that require modern, ready-to-deploy defense technology. The increasing use of drones in modern warfare is radically changing the battlefield, creating new threats that require innovative countermeasures. These include directed energy (DE) weapons, particularly lasers, which stand out for their accuracy and effectiveness. These technologies are becoming important tools to counter unmanned aerial systems (UAS), which play an increasingly important role in today's conflicts. UAVs pose a significant threat to military personnel and equipment. Their low production cost, ability to transport various payloads, and reduced risk of injury to operators make them particularly attractive to both state and non-state actors. Recent conflicts, such as those in Ukraine, Yemen and Gaza, have highlighted the growing importance of drones in military operations. In response to this growing threat, the military is investing heavily in counter-UAS systems (CUAS), where laser technologies, with their rapid target neutralization capabilities and long-term cost-effectiveness, will play a central role in defense strategies. Mobile High Energy Laser Weapon System FIREFLY. Video: KORD

Title: The fifth wave — higher than two meters: - Book flood - will sweep through Ukraine and distribute mo...
Description: This is the fifth wave of the initiative launched in 2015, shortly after the beginning of the open armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine. As before, it is aimed at popularizing reading and supporting libraries from different regions of Ukraine - both front-line and those that sheltered many forced migrants. This time, as part of the -Book Rush-, more than 31,000 books will be transferred to Ukrainian libraries, including books for children and teenagers, Ukrainian classics and modern literature of various genres, translations of foreign authors, popular science literature and books about the war experience, works of veterans and volunteers. The co-organizers of the -Book Rush- told the correspondent of ArmiyaInform about the action. — The National Military Historical Museum of Ukraine is a museum of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine system, a military museum. When we learned that the fifth wave of the -Book Rush- action would take place, we offered to join it, says Yuriy Bilous, deputy director of the National Military Historical Museum of Ukraine. In particular, a small exhibition was placed at the entrance to the museum, which presents all the books that will be transferred to libraries within the initiative. - This is necessary so that anyone can see the total volume of collected books. After all, there will be 300 sets of 100 books each, which will be distributed to the libraries of Kharkiv, Sumy, Poltava, Mykolaiv, Ivano-Frankivsk and Volyn regions, he explains. It is important for people to see this volume visually, because the information about 100 books that will be transferred to each library is a certain abstraction. When you collect the books together on one shelf or put them in a stack, it is already a small library of modern Ukrainian literature. - One hundred books is a lot. If it is conventionally assumed that each book is at least two centimeters thick, then the height of a column of stacked books will be more than two meters, says the deputy director of the National Military Historical Museum. Several books from the collected list relate in one way or another to military topics, talk about the modern Russian-Ukrainian war - an aggressive war on the part of the Russian Federation and a just defensive war on the part of Ukraine. - Since we are a military museum, together with the organizers of -Book Rush- we paid special attention to this, - explains Yuriy Bilous. However, since the selection is intended primarily for the average mass Ukrainian reader, the share of books on military topics is not decisive in it. In view of this, in addition to the basic standard set of books for libraries, the organizers plan to create a special selection of books specifically for the military. — There are many children's books, books for teenagers, which are less needed by the military. Therefore, there will be a separate list specifically for adults, for the military, he says. The museum owner invites everyone to visit the National Military History Museum of Ukraine, because in it you can not only see with your own eyes books from the fifth wave of the -Book Flood-, but also get acquainted with unique exhibits from the history of the Ukrainian military. — This is the fifth wave of the -Book Rush- launched by the -Information Resistance- group. The first took place back in 2015. Then, in addition to our usual activities - monitoring the situation, identifying and investigating security risks, countering aggression against Ukraine in the information sphere, we also decided to pay more attention to communication with people -on the ground-, - says the coordinator of the -Information Resistance- group. historian and museum expert Oleksiy Kopytko. One of the effective options was cooperation with libraries and the dissemination of modern Ukrainian literature, organization of scientific and educational events. — At first, emphasis was placed on literature of a historical profile. Our first waves of actions were connected with books about the Holodomor, with the distribution of the ten-volume popular science book -History without censorship- from the public educational project to popularize the history of Ukraine -likbez. Historical front-. Instead, we have now put together a universal kit aimed at popularizing Ukrainian books and reading in general, he explains. The demand from libraries for new literature, which is catastrophically lacking, is very high. Books are needed by all readers of all ages, so in the fifth wave of the -Book Rush- they tried to please every taste and preference. - This is children's literature, which includes both new classics and works on the school curriculum. It is also scientific popular literature, including several encyclopedias of a natural nature. This is literature for teenagers, this is what is called -non-fiction- - modern and classic Ukrainian and translated literature, says Oleksiy Kopytko. — A separate block consists of books related to understanding the experience of modern war. This is an experience of different regions - there are books about Okhtyrka, several books about Kharkiv, about Kherson. We want to collect such a palette of books that make up a certain -military- kit for any reader, - explains the coordinator of -Information Resistance-. Having received such a universal set, the library will be able to offer different groups of readers the latest Ukrainian publications that will be of interest to them. — Since the resources are quite limited and, so to speak, not comparable to the need, we decided to focus primarily on several regions from the East and South of Ukraine. First of all, these are Kharkiv, Sumy, Poltava and Mykolaiv regions. We also included two regions of Western Ukraine — Volynsk and Ivano-Frankivsk, because many people moved from the East and found shelter that way, as well as in the central regions, he says. Also, the -Information Resistance- group establishes contacts with the training centers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. There you need literature for conducting classes - about weapons, about battle tactics, publication of motivational and psychological content, etc. — We are now preparing to form a certain set of books that will go to educational centers with an orientation primarily to instructors. We started a certain dialogue in order to understand what they specifically need and what is needed as a priority, because the needs are huge and it is necessary to understand the best way to ensure them, Oleksiy Kopytko said. public libraries, is already rolling across Ukraine. Organizers have completed accepting and selecting applications and are starting to ship books to selected libraries. The libraries of the Sumy region will be the first. — We had the following approach: formally, there are more than 10,000 public libraries in Ukraine. Unfortunately, some of them are, to put it mildly, -inanimate-. We wanted to find those libraries of various levels that are important to their communities. They can be small, but if there is life in the village around the library, some events are taking place, children come or people of all ages come - then we wanted to strengthen such libraries within the boundaries of -Book Crowd-, - explains Oleksiy Kopytko. For this review, the organizers, in addition to reviewing applications, also looked at library websites, pages and groups in social networks, which show how active and important the library is to the local community. So far, the -Information Resistance- group has collected more than 31,000 books from 26 publishing houses, more than 40 books from the set were published in the book capital of Ukraine — near the frontline, Kharkiv. Three sets of 101 books each have already gone to the first three libraries. Read also: - A book on the front: what the defenders are reading at -zero- More about the -Book Rush- action from the -Information Resistance- group and the National Military-Historical the Museum of Ukraine can be found on the project's pages in social networks Facebook and Telegram.

Title: In the swamps, counterfeiters attack computer games: why is this the enemy
Description: Plots from video games see them everywhere. For example, propagandists are spreading information on social networks that the German TV channel allegedly used footage from the American video game -Call of Duty- in the video of the assault on Russian positions by soldiers of the Azov brigade in the Pokrovsky direction. But in fact, this is not Pokrovsky direction, but Serebryansk forestry in Luhansk region. The video was shot in first person and is divided into three sections: advancing through positions, mopping up, and securing after the assault. There are no computer graphics on it. Apparently, the Russians still cannot believe that the Ukrainians are capable of defending their native land so selflessly. For them, the heroism of the military is beyond reality, so they believe in the fictions of their fakers.

Title: - Footage from drones resembles scenes from Hollywood action movies - fighters about repelling the s...
Description: A video of the combat operation appearedon the unit's page on November 25. -Thanks to the coordinated work of our units, we stopped the enemy, inflicting significant losses on him. Footage from drones, on which every moment of the battle is recorded, resembles scenes from Hollywood action movies. But this is not a movie. This is the harsh reality of today's war in Ukraine,- the fighters commented. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 60th mechanized Ingulets brigade showed destruction of Russians who decided to attack on -Niva- passenger cars, protected only by camouflage and electronic radar.

Title: Destroyed the Russian infantry fighting vehicle and infantry with two mines: the story of the former...
Description: His story was published by Army. Pavlo -Beton- is the commander of the mortar unit of the 60th separate mechanized Ingulets brigade. He repels enemy assaults almost every day, covering his comrades. Pavlo strikes at enemy concentrations and equipment, despite continuous fire from enemy artillery and tanks. -During one of the battles, -Beton- deliberately destroyed a stationary BMP of the enemy, under which enemy infantry was hiding. Two 120-mm mines were enough for this - the technicians tore off the tower, and the infantrymen were burned,- said the Ground Forces. Pavel admits that he wants even more such results. His main motivation is to protect his fellow vanguards. For his courage and skill, Pavlo was awarded the Golden Cross. -Beton- was born in the city of Kryvyi Rih. Before the full-scale invasion, he worked as a locksmith. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 60th mechanized Ingulets brigade showed destruction of the Russians who decided to attack in Niva cars protected only by camouflage and REB.

Title: - The enemy has no chance in armor - our fighters showed footage of the destruction of three BMP and...
Description: They published a video of combat work on their channel on November 25. -The enemy has no chance in armor when our pilots are working! 3 BMP and 1 BBM were destroyed,- Ukrainian fighters said. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the unmanned systems battalion of the 110th mechanized brigade named after Corporal General Mark Bezruchka destroyed 6 enemy transport means.

Title: Rustem Umyerov: We expect that partners will take the initiative in equipping our brigades
Description: This is stated in the minister's message on the Facebook page. -Allies' support will become faster and more effective. The defenders of Ukraine must be provided with everything necessary to put an end to Russian aggression,- said Rustem Umyerov. The ministers discussed the urgent needs of the Defense Forces, as well as the priority areas of assistance to Ukraine. -We count on the fact that partners will take the initiative in equipping our brigades and battalions. We have a successful experience of cooperation with France, which provided training for one of the Ukrainian brigades and also provided it with armored vehicles,- said Rustem Umyerov. Another area of ​​support is strengthening our anti-aircraft defenses ahead of winter. The enemy does not stop trying to destroy our critical infrastructure, so we need more air defense systems and ammunition for them. The next important issue is artillery ammunition. Rustem Umyerov thanked our European partners for providing Ukraine with 1 million artillery shells, but noted that Ukraine needs more to achieve parity with the enemy. -Together with its allies, Ukraine is already building the potential of the domestic defense industry. We invite the countries of the free world to transfer technology to us and start strategic partnerships with our industry,- he said. The minister informed the partners about the areas in which we see significant opportunities for cooperation: At the same time, it is planned to conduct an audit with the allied states of the aid provided during 2022, 2023 and 2024 in order to determine which models of support to Ukraine worked best and scale them up. Ukraine is also open to new initiatives that will help quickly meet the needs of our soldiers in 2025. -We must act boldly and coherently. Only in this way will we be able to achieve a just and lasting peace in Europe,- Rustem Umyerov stressed. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine reached specific agreements with Norway, Denmark, Sweden and Lithuania on investing directly in Ukrainian production.

Title: The enemy DRG was stopped in the north of the Kharkiv region: part of the Russian saboteurs were eli...
Description: The spokesperson of Kharkiv OTU, Lt. Col. Yevhenii Romanov, told about this on the broadcast of the Suspilne Novosti marathon. -It was immediately partially destroyed, partially retreated to the territory of the Russian Federation,- he said. The spokesman explained that the actions of the DRG in border areas are a common practice. - Subversive intelligence groups are a common Russian practice. They try to enter in small groups in order to find out where there is some opening for them - an opportunity to enter, start a fight or advance somewhere. But these efforts always end in the same way - with the corpses of Russians, - assured Yevhenii Romanov. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the Defense Forces stopped the breakthrough of Russian saboteurs in Kharkiv Oblast.

Title: Attack -into the heart-: our drone flew into the Russian BTR-82
Description: The video of combat operation appeared on November 25 on the unit's page. In the video, you can see how a Ukrainian drone flies into the BTR-82, as well as the destruction of 2 mortars, the Tigr, Buhanka, machine gun positions, the Urals, and several occupants. FPV FIRE POWER: ACHILLES SHOCK AIRCRAFT BATTALION DESTROYES ENEMY EQUIPMENT IN KHARKIV Oblast Thanks to the community @sternenko for the donated FPV drones. Donat on RUSORIZ - many good deeds are ahead pic.twitter.com/ySA4p6bqmn — BUBpAK “ACHILLES” 92 OSHBr (@achilles_92osbr) November 25, 2024 As reported by ArmyInform, the battalion of attack unmanned air systems -Achilles- of the 92nd assault brigade named after the basket chieftain Ivan Sirk hit two heavy flamethrowers at once TOS-1A -Solntsepok- salvo fire system.

Title: In the battle to the slaughter or to the tribunal: in the Siverskyi direction, the Russians are moti...
Description: Major Anastasia Bobovnikova, spokeswoman of Luhansk OTU, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni- . The depressed mood among Russian soldiers is due to the extremely high level of casualties and the lack of success in the Siversk region. -Already now we can say about unsuccessful operations, unsuccessful assaults in the previous period of time - for about a month they tried to storm with equipment using a large amount of equipment that was completely broken and destroyed,- the spokeswoman said. In an attempt to rectify the situation, the Russians replaced the command staff here, and deployed military police on the ranks. — As a result of this, there were big changes in the enemy group standing in the Seversky direction: the brigade commander was changed, the combatants were changed. The military police came, as far as we know, in order to -motivate- the personnel to go into battle, the officer said. However, even this does not give the desired result to the Russian invaders - the soldiers of the Russian army refuse to perform combat tasks. ArmyInform previously reported that propagandystiv/->in OTU -Luhansk- denied the statements of Russian propagandists about the advance of the occupiers to the northern part Toretska.

Title: The escape attempt ended with a call to the rescuers: three men barely survived in Tisza
Description: About this notifies November 25 State Border Service of Ukraine. -The men used the services of traders who promised to help them cross the border by land, but after paying for the -service- they were told that they would still have to go into the water,- the report said. It is noted that the shippers, traditionally disregarding the lives of their customers, directed them to the Tisza after dark, lying that the water there was knee-deep, the river itself was not wide, and therefore they would cross it with ease and would not even have time to freeze. No flotation devices or life jackets were offered to the men. -Taking off their shoes and slightly rolling up their pants, the divers went into an unknown body of water,- said the DPSU. In just a few minutes, all three were washed away by a powerful current and carried away in an unknown direction. According to the border guards, the only thing that saved the men was the fact that there was a washed-up tree in the water, which they were able to grab onto and get to the shallows in the middle of the river. Then they called the rescuers and reported that they needed help. Military personnel of the -Vylok- and -Dyakovo- border service departments of the Mukachevo border detachment were involved in the search for offenders. As a result of using a drone, the -islanders- were discovered. All three were taken to a border unit, where servicemen gave them hot tea and allowed them to warm up and dry their clothes and shoes. For an attempt to violate the state border, administrative offenses were filed against the men. -The water level in the Tisza River, which runs along the border with Hungary and Romania, has risen significantly at the moment. The water temperature is very low, which causes muscle cramps in those who try to dive into the river. Under such conditions, the human body becomes uncontrollable, which can lead to death,- the DPSU emphasized. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: There are no occupiers in the northern part of Toretsk: the OTU - Luhansk - refuted the statements o...
Description: Major Anastasia Bobovnikova, spokeswoman of Luhansk OTU, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni- . — In the Toretsk direction, the number of assaults did not decrease, accordingly, the losses of Russians in manpower in this direction did not decrease either. They remain consistently high, she said. The spokeswoman did not confirm the information of Russian propagandists about the advance of Russians in the northern part of the city. — In the northern part of the city, they have not yet appeared. Although I must also repeat that urban battles are one of the most difficult battles in military practice, military science. They are characterized by dynamism and require constant attention from servicemen and constant tension, she said. At the same time, the military woman noted that during battles in the city it is difficult to talk about the details of the situation, because the enemy may unexpectedly appear on a neighboring street for a while and will be forced to leave it or be destroyed just as suddenly. — It is difficult to say what the situation is in the city itself, specifically on this or that street. The enemy may run into the neighboring street, but this does not mean that he is entrenched there. They immediately destroy him, immediately make it impossible for him to move or take him prisoner, - explained Anastasia Bobovnikova. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Toretsk, the enemy loses 100 soldiers per day.

Title: President: The weapons tasks for this year will definitely be fulfilled, and for the next one as wel...
Description: He said this in his evening address. -We will definitely respond to Russia for everything it does. And it is important that such blows, each of them, do not remain without a proper response, not only ours. There should not be even a hint of normalization of Russian terror — of getting used to it,- the President said. The head of state noted the new decision of Britain regarding sanctions against the shadow tanker fleet of the Russian Federation, according to which 30 tankers came under restrictions. -This is an important step. And it would be right for European partners — at the level of the entire EU — as well as other partners to support such sanctions. The less Russian excess profits from oil, the less Russia will be able to wage war. This is an obvious connection. A relationship that must work for real peace,- he said. Volodymyr Zelenskyi also announced that today at the meeting Bets were relevant reports and analysis of experience in repelling Russian strikes on energy. -The best results of specific units should be spread to all objects, to everyone who carries out protective work,- he emphasized. The production and supply of drones, missiles, and other weapons were also discussed. -All weapons tasks for this year will definitely be completed. Also for the next one. Chief of Staff Syrsky reported separately - there was a long conversation about all key parts of the front, as well as about the Kursk operation,- added the President.

Title: The motorcycle is on fire, the armored vehicle is destroyed: -deadly- accuracy of the Third Assault
Description: A video of combat work appearedon the unit's page on November 25. The video shows the destruction of an enemy armored personnel carrier, a truck, a camouflaged mortar and a motorcycle. -Enemy infantrymen who were traveling on motorcycles were discovered. Having reached this point, the enemy got rid of the equipment. To preserve the motorcycles, they decided to disguise them, hoping that we would not notice. But our FPV is already flying to the target. The operator deftly controls the drone, directing it directly to the motorcycle,- the military recalled. According to them, the drone hit the equipment and the motorcycle started burning. -The battalion of unmanned systems continues to actively work and destroy the enemy. We destroy the enemy every day!- - commented the defenders. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the Third Assault Brigade cleared the village of Kopanka, into which the invaders broke through in Kharkiv Oblast. During the sweep, part of the Russians was destroyed, a part is taken prisoner.

Title: Air defense of the Ground Forces destroyed 178 enemy drones in a week
Description: This was reported by the commander of the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Lieutenant General Oleksandr Pavliuk. Our defenders shot down 129 Shahed-131/136 attack drones, seven Orlan 10/30 UAVs and 17 Zala reconnaissance drones. Also, five Supercam UAVs, 14 Lancets and six Molniya drones will be successfully destroyed. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 25 in the South there was ta-pyat-rozviduvalnyh-bpla/->destroyed ballistic missile -Iskander-M- and five reconnaissance drones the enemy

Title: The MOU named the key factors of the modern armed conflict
Description: About this he said during a speech at the 16th International Security Forum in the Canadian city of Halifax. Serhii Boev emphasized the critical importance of increasing investments in the defense complex. Without a strong defense industrial complex, it will be difficult for democracies to withstand an enemy that is increasingly mobilizing its economy. In the current situation, the democracies should increase and speed up the production of their high-quality weapons,- the deputy minister noted. He added that, even despite the hostilities and constant Russian shelling, Ukrainian defense companies produce high-quality weapons and military equipment and are ready to increase volumes under the conditions of additional funding. -To defeat the aggressor, we need to jointly increase our capabilities,- said Serhii Boev. As reported by ArmyInform, Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine for European Integration Serhiy Boyev held a meeting with the Deputy Minister of National Defense of Canada on Budget Matters by Stephanie Beck.

Title: Armed Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces: in the South, today they shot down an Iskander-M missile...
Description: This was reported by the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Also, in the southern direction, five reconnaissance drones were destroyed - two UAVs -Orlan- and one each of -Fenix-, -Merlin-VR- and Supercam. The number of victims as a result of a rocket attack on a densely populated area of ​​Odesa osib/->increased to 11 people. Damaged and destroyed residential buildings, other objects of civil infrastructure, cars Currently, it is known that 11 citizens were injured. Information on their number is being clarified. At the scene of the incident, the work of the operational headquarters was deployed to provide assistance to the victims. All specialized services are working.

Title: The special forces are working: the fighters have written off dozens of units of Russian equipment
Description: The relevant video was released on November 25 by the SBU. -Special agents of the SBU -wrote off- another batch of enemy equipment,- the message reads. In particular, they struck: The fighters also destroyed 449 occupiers. Earlier, ArmyInform showed how the soldiers of the SBU sbu-podilylysya-rezultatamy-roboty/->turn enemy equipment into scrap and destroy the occupiers.

Title: They detained men and demanded money for postponement of mobilization: employees of the Odessa TCC w...
Description: About this informsNovember 25 State Bureau of Investigation. The undercover officers stopped the men, recorded their personal data and informed them that they planned to take them to the TCC for mobilization. For money, TCC employees promised to -release- conscripts and help arrange deferment from service. This service was estimated at 4.5 thousand. US dollars. In case of refusal to pay the money, the men were threatened with a wanted notice. -Law enforcement officers, in particular, documented the fact of extorting money from a man who had relatives among the missing during combat missions. Therefore, on legal grounds, he had a postponement from mobilization,- the SBI noted. On November 21, 2024, SBI officers detained one of the middlemen while receiving payment for the -service-. The question of detention and notification of suspicion to the rest of the participants of the arrangement is being resolved. Currently, the detainee has been notified of the suspicion of receiving an illegal benefit by an official (Part 3 of Article 368 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). The sanction of the article provides for punishment in the form of imprisonment for a term of up to 10 years. -During the search of the premises of one of the possible suspects, he took out a service weapon and pointed it at the DBR employees. He brought the firearm to a combat position, demanded the return of the seized mobile phone and to leave his house with threats,- the SBI said.
